page.title: 10Watford: The Canal
page.content:
During the heyday of canal systems the {Grand Junction}Canal was built and ran through Watford. Later it became combined with the Union canal, and so became the{Grand Union Canal}that we know today.
In the past it was a major transport system, but the advent first of the railway (qv) and then of road transport quickly sealed its fate.
In Watford the canal did not fall derelict and today provides a major leisure amenity for local people (privately run evening cruises) and strangers (several holiday firms hire out cut down narrow boats) who use it as a route through the town both North and South.
